add.semantics: Performs reg1 = reg2 + reg3. If the computation overflows, then the overflow flag is set

sub.semantics: Performs reg1 = reg2 - reg3. In case reg3 In case reg3 > reg2, 0 is writte to reg1 and overflow flag is set.

mov.semantics: Performs reg1 = $Imm . where Imm is a 8 bit value.

ld.semantics: Loads data from mem_addr into reg1.

st.semantics: Stores data from reg1 to mem_addr.

mul.semantics: Performs reg1 = reg2 x reg3. If the computation overflows, then the overflow flag is set.

div.semantics: Performs reg3/reg4. Stores the quotient in R0 and the remainder in R1.

rs.semantics: Right shifts reg1 by $Imm, where $Imm is an 8 bit value.
Left shifts reg1 by $Imm, where $Imm is an 8 bit value.

xor.semantics: Performs bitwise XOR of reg2 and reg3. Stores the result in reg1.

or.semantics: Performs bitwise OR of reg2 and reg3. Stores the result in reg1.

and.semantics: Performs bitwise AND of reg2 and reg3. Stores the result in reg1.

not.semantics: Performs bitwise NOT of reg2. Stores the result in reg1.

cmp.semantics: Compares reg1 and reg2 and sets up the FLAGS register.

jmp.semantics: Jumps to mem_addr where mem_addr is a memory address

jlt.semantics: Jumps to mem_addr if the leass than flag is set (less than flag=1), where mem_addr is a memory address

jgt.semantics: Jumps to mem_addr if the greater than flag is set (greater than flag = 1), where mem_addr is a memory address

je.semantics: Jumps to mem_addr if the equal flag is set (equal flag = 1), where mem_addr is a memory address

hlt.semantics: Stops the machine from executing until reset
